Class BoardTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • BoardTests
  • public class BoardTests
extends java.lang.Object
    Unit tests used throughout development of the board class, allowing for testing of its methods.

      static Board board

        public void checkMoves​(GameValue gameValue,
                       Board board,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Piece> blackPieces,

        Checking that all the moves for left and right stored in a game value object are valid
        Parameters:
        gameValue - GameValue object to check moves of
        board - board that we are checking against
        blackPieces - black pieces on the board
        whitePieces - white pieces on the board

      • testMovesTransformed0

        public void testMovesTransformed0()
        Testing that moves are transformed to the smallest hash version, and correctly back after being retrieved from the endgame database. Transformation = 0, no transformation ------------- ------------- 1 | | W | B | 1 | | W | B | ------------- ------------- 0 | X | | X | 0 | X | | X | ------------- ------------- A B C A B C Original board Smallest Hash Board

Transformation = 1, vertical flip ------------- ------------- 1 | | | | 1 | | | | ------------- ------------- 0 | B | | W | 0 | W | | B | ------------- ------------- A B C A B C Original board Smallest Hash Board

Transformation = 2, horizontal flip ------------- ------------- 1 | | | | 1 | B | W | | ------------- ------------- 0 | B | W | | 0 | | | | ------------- ------------- A B C A B C Original board Smallest Hash Board

      • testEvaluateWithSplit

        public void testEvaluateWithSplit()
        Testing evaluate() in case where board can be split into partitions. 4 partitions, 2 of which have pieces. Board only has 1 good move for black, c1 -> b2 and shoot c1. ------------------------- 5 | | X | X | B | | | ------------------------- 4 | | X | X | | | W | ------------------------- 3 | X | X | X | X | X | X | ------------------------- 2 | X | | W | X | X | | ------------------------- 1 | | X | B | X | X | | ------------------------- 0 | | | | X | | | ------------------------- A B C D E F

      • testEvaluateWithSplit2

        public void testEvaluateWithSplit2()
        Testing evaluate() in case where board can be split into partitions. Whites move is to shoot back at the starting square, so this tests that the starting and burned squares offset values are applied correctly, when both the starting and burned squares refer to the same square object. ------------------------- 5 | X | X | X | | X | | ------------------------- 4 | X | X | B | X | X | X | ------------------------- 3 | X | X | X | X | W | X | ------------------------- 2 | X | X | X | X | | X | ------------------------- 1 | W | X | B | X | X | X | ------------------------- 0 | X | X | X | | X | X | ------------------------- A B C D E F
